title: The BEST AI Vibe Coding Stack & Workflow

rawLines.text: Hey everyone, in this video I want to
talk about the modern tech stack to
build apps. Mostly AI tools that I use
and basically the typical workflow that
I go through with these AI tools to
build an app these days. Obviously AI
has completely changed the game. You are
probably already using one or two AI
tools. But I think the text stack is
going to be not just one or two, it's
going to be everything. And so let's
actually just take a look at some of the
tools that you can use these days
because I think they can improve your
productivity by a lot. These AI tools
aren't replacing us right now. They are
mostly productivity tools at the moment.
And they can be a big benefit if you
know what to use and how to use them.
And so let's actually go through a
typical workflow of building an app and
see how it all fits together. So let's
say I have an app idea. I'm allergic to
peanuts. And so when I go out to a
restaurant and I get some food on my
plate, I want to know if there are
peanuts in there. So I want to be able
to take a picture of my food on my plate
and the app should guess if there are
peanuts in there. Right? That's an app
idea. So, where would I start if I want
to build an app like that? Where would I
start? Well, in the beginning, um I
would probably just uh chat a little bit
with a chat AI app. So, obviously, Chat
GPT is very popular for that. There's
also Claude. There are some other chat

chat GPT myself. I'm thinking allows the
user to take food on a plate and the app

peanut. Right. Now for who is the app is
also important to mention it's for
people who are allergic to peanut right
so if you want to build apps I think
this is a actually a good strategy for
generating good ideas what are the
problems that you personally run into
because if you have a problem it's
pretty likely that there are other
people out there in the world that have
a similar problem so I see a lot of
people they build apps but it's unclear
for who the app is and whether it's
actually a problem or not. So if you
just stick to problems that you have
yourself, it's a higher likelihood that
you're actually building something that

there's already a good suggestion here.
